departmentDescription: From the classics to the contemporary, the Department of English offers Rhodes students a wide array of courses in literature, creative writing, and film. Students develop the ability to analyze and create with an emphasis on establishing strong writing skills.

courses: For a literature concentration
English 285
Four courses from Medieval, Renaissance/Early Modern, 18th Century, 19th Century, and 20th-21st Century categories
One course in Diversity and Difference
One course in In Focus
One course in Topics in Literary Theory
English 485
Up to two special courses may count towards the major. At least seven courses must be numbered 300 or above.
For a Literture and Creative Writing Concentration:
English 285
One course from Medieval, Renaissance/Early Modern, 18th Century, 19th Century, or 20th-21st Century categories
One course from Diversity and Difference
One course from In Focus
One course from Topics in Literary Theory
English 485
Workshop courses in Introduction to Creative Writing, Intermediate Workshop I and II, and Advanced Workshop
At least seven courses must be numbered 300 or above.

requirements: Fulfillment of the requirements for a major in English
Approval by the English Honors Committee

courses: For a Creative Writing minor:
English 210
Intermediate Workshop I
Intermediate Workshop II
Advanced Workshop
One additional English course at the 200 level or above
For an English Minor:
Two courses at the 190 or 200 level
Three additional courses in English numbered 300 or higher

resources.writingCenter: The Department oversees a writing service available to all Rhodes students. Student tutors are available daily to assist students with written work.
